item.title: Reticulate Explained With Abalones
item.description: library(reticulate) Sys.setenv(Reticulate_Python = "C:/Users/shigg/AppData/Local/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate/python.exe") use_python("C:/Users/shigg/AppData/Local/r-miniconda/envs/r-reticulate/python.exe") conda_create("r-reticulate") ## [1] "C:\\Users\\shigg\\AppData\\Local\\r-miniconda\\envs\\r-reticulate\\python.exe" use_condaenv("r-reticulate") py_install("pandas") ‘Reticulate’ is an R package that allows you to call python from R. Doing so will allow you to work with R and python interchangeably within RStudio’s R Markdown feature. import pandas as pd ab = pd.read_csv(r'\Users\shigg\OneDrive\Documents\College Notes\PyRe\Data sets\abalone_original.csv') ab = ab[['sex','rings']] print(ab) ## sex rings ## 0 M 15 ## 1 M 7 ## 2 F 9 ## 3 M 10 ## 4 I 7 ## .
